newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Dalai Lama arrives in Australia, meets Downer.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Dalai Lama arrives in Australia, meets Downer.

text.p: The Dalai Lama, Tibet's exiled spiritual leader, arrived in Sydney on Saturday following a New Zealand tour that attracted Chinese diplomatic threats.
Australian Foreign Affairs Minister Alexander Downer met the Dalai Lama upon his arrival from New Zealand but immediately said the talks were not official.

"My wife (Nicky) and I as Australian citizens were happy to accede to the request made by the Dalai Lama's party for us to meet with him and I met him in a private capacity and met him as a very distinguished and well known religious leader," Downer told reporters after the meeting.
Earlier, the Australian opposition demanded that Prime Minister John Howard also meet him.
Chinese Premier Li Peng warned Australia last month against official contact with the Dalai Lama, and Howard is not currently scheduled to meet the Buddhist monk during the two-week visit.
"The New Zealand Prime Minister has now met with the Dalai Lama," Labor Opposition Foreign Affairs spokesman Laurie Brereton said in a statement.
"It is high time John Howard told the Australian public whether he will do likewise."
The Dalai Lama, in exile from his Chinese-controlled country since 1959, met New Zealand Prime Minister Jim Bolger on Wednesday.
But China, insisting the Dalai Lama is leading a pro-independence cause, routinely objects to leaders of other states meeting him.

"We have paid great attention to his (the Dalai Lama's) meetings with New Zealand leaders," a Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman said on Thursday, adding that they clearly interfered in internal Chinese affairs and would affect relations with New Zealand.
The Dalai Lama is scheduled to visit Melbourne, Canberra and Sydney to attend Buddhist celebrations, make speeches and hold news conferences.
